title: Renters - Internal handling - Unable to attach files when dispatching a vendor

What was supposed to happen?
When dispatching a vendor, we attach documents to support the request and then process the dispatch.
What's actually happening?
Once selecting attachments, the next screen (description) is blank for dispatching the vendor. If you remove the attachments, the system allows you to process the vendor attachment.
Steps you took before finding this bug
1. Dispatch Vendor 
2. Select Vendor
3. Reason for dispatch
4. Attachments for the dispatch
What area is the issue in?
 Claims
What is the impact?
 An issue is blocking me from doing something for a customer

 A few Makers are impacted (<10)

 Yes

title: Renters - Internal handling - VC integration bug
description:
What was supposed to happen?
VC integration kept us from moving forward, maybe due to the size of the inventory. Entered a 1 line item for RCV/ACV to push through. Should be able to set the amount on "Review Inventory" task and then proceed to "Pay Contents" and issue payment as necessary.
What's actually happening?
Between "Review Inventory" task and "Pay Contents" task, the amount is automatically updating back to limits (or over limits), and not allowing us to pay.
Steps you took before finding this bug
Attempted multiple times and ways to push payment forward. 
Claimed amount: $35,621.15 
RCV $30,000
ACV $27,400.16
What area is the issue in?
 Claims
What is the impact?
 An issue is blocking me from doing something for a customer
Who is impacted?
 I'm the only one with this issue
Is there a workaround?
 No
Marilyn Hutton | 
 |

comments.content:
marilyn.hutton:
We are not able to update the depreciation to be a dollar amount in VC so it has to be done in Blender
attachment 1

marilyn.hutton:
@javiera.verdugo for John Brant

marilyn.hutton:
@thomas.hudson Can you please help us get some traction on this?

marilyn.hutton:
The math was not matching up when the inventory was going through the normal integration. Our work around to that is to handle as a single line item for rcv/acv.
Sometimes we run into this error where we input the rcv and acv, but then blender reverts it back to rcv.

lior.eliyahu:
Blender will always take the amount listed in VC for both RCV and ACV
since the ACV in VC was listed as 
30K
 - then blender takes this number and update it. How the flow should work is that we list all items in VC, then Blender takes the amounts, calculates if needs to pay ACV or RCV and let to issue the payment. Numbers are not suppose to be edited inside Blender, so when we try to issue a payment as one line item, same will happen. The question is - what does it mean that the match was not matching up? this is the issue to be solved here. do you have a cart where all items should be listed?

javiera.verdugo:
hi lior! this is the original inventory.
when i was getting ready to pay, the amount was 1/3 of the ACV listed and when i went back to "review inventory", blender had automatically rejected more than 20 items and i would active the rejected items to move forward with payment but then it would reject them again. it happened at least 3x and the prices kept changing. eventually, we decided to try a one line item for RCV/ACV so we can move to settle the claim friday, i was able to get to the "pay claim" section and select payment method but i didn't as we do have RD held back but limits will be reached once RD receipts submitted so not sure if we should just pay limits at this point or try another work around somehow
attachment 1
do you have the cart in VC? im not sure if we are able to solve the original issue without seeing it.

javiera.verdugo:
i originally did but now it's all gone except for the one line item... i didn't delete the other items so not sure what happened. the PDF i provided was the original cart :sob:

marilyn.hutton:
We cannot restore the cart back without the help of VC.
We are not able to update the ACV in VC because it does not have that functionality. In VC, the ACV is applied based on age. We do not have the option to type in a freeform amount, as we are trying to do

katy.diamond:
Here for visibility. I am experiencing the same issue.

@katy.diamond can you link your claim

the bug was causing integration to ignore the last page. This should fix the issue with integration rejecting the last items.

Steps you took before finding this bug

What area is the issue in?

Who is impacted?
 I'm the only one with this issue
Is there a workaround?
 No
Erin Flor | 
 |

comments.content: erin.flor:

erin.flor:
Active policy LP44D29DC84 not populating when trying to file claim under correct policy.

erin.flor:
Please change the priority of this ticket to high, I am unable to file a new manual claim under the correct policy and cannot assist customer or move forward with claim

nathan.boettcher:
@erin.flor Following up here. Since the date of loss was March 31, 2025, the user did not have an `Active` policy on the DOL. Their last `Active` policy was LP7534F1D64, which `Expired` on Aug 12, 2024 due to non-renewal. Shouldn't the claim just be denied due to no active policy on DOL?

erin.flor:
@nathan.boettcher I have drafted a Denial letter and am waiting on the approval based on your last note! I was just confused based on the labels on the policy/user pages in Blender, and also that this policy LP44D29DC84 was not notated as nonrenewed in the customer's User Timeline

nathan.boettcher:
@erin.flor The way non-renewals work is that the renewal policy still gets generated in the system and triggers UW to review it. However, the non-renewal applies to the policy that's actually non-renewed, not the renewal policy. So, the non-renewed policy will show as `Expired` and have an alert showing `Non Renewed`. The renewal that never became active will just show `Canceled Renewal`.

comments.content: Bug Investigation Report: Duplicate Payment Tasks Due to Workflow Synchronization Deduplication failure.

igor.eisenberg:
TL;DR :
When claim switches between "legacy" and "v2" workflows and task synchronisation is triggered, task de-duplication fails that legacy-created payment tasks are same as v2-created payment tasks. title: Renters - Internal handling - Can't close task on a claim, getting "oops" error
description:
What was supposed to happen?
Trying to reject loss of use payment as it's been paid by APC. Should allow you to reject payment and close the task.
What's actually happening?
Whenever I try to reject payment, or close the task it gives me an error "oops" 
If I try to close the claim, it gives me the same error
Steps you took before finding this bug
tried refreshing the page, exiting the browser, tried logging out of Banyan and back in
What area is the issue in?
 Claims
What is the impact?
 A tool is not working (but it's not blocking from serving customers)
Who is impacted?
 I'm the only one with this issue
Is there a workaround?
 No
Robert Rumsey | 
 |

comments.content:
Wild Moose:
Consistent *500 errors* from *home-blender* for both *reject* and *close* actions on claim *LC6EFD85B3*, matching user reports. Backend failure is confirmed and reproducible; developers should investigate *home-blender* and downstream *monolith-api* for this claim. For more details, see the relevant logs at: 
https://app.datadoghq.com/logs?query=%40level%3A(40%20OR%2050)%20env%3Aproduction%20stage%3Aproduction%20*%3ALC6EFD85B3&from_ts=1749064804062&to_ts=1749669604062&live=false
 _*Disclaimer:* These error logs have been located and analyzed by AI. Human review is advised for final confirmation._

title: Home US - Internal handling - Blender- Dispatch workflow error
description:
What was supposed to happen?
Workflow should've updated that dispatch has been submitted and show the timeline for getting estimation.
What's actually happening?
Blender shows "Oops... something went wrong. Report a bug if this continues" and does not reflect that field inspection assignment was submitted.
Steps you took before finding this bug
Checked into XA, found that the assignment is in Queue. Dismissing task on the blender workflow and made note to confirm that XA does confirm assignment went through
What area is the issue in?
 Claims
What is the impact?
 Visible issue (wrong text/wrong email/typo/missing icon)
Who is impacted?
 A few Makers are impacted (<10)
Is there a workaround?
 Yes
Vivian Le | 
 |

comments.content:
Wild Moose:
*Monolith* and *databus* services failed to publish and validate the *claims.claim_submitted_v2* event for claim *LC41456F688* due to missing required fields ('userPublicId', 'policyPublicId', 'subrogation'), causing the workflow to halt and the user-facing error in *Blender*. For more details, see the relevant logs at: 
https://app.datadoghq.com/logs?query=%40level%3A(40%20OR%2050)%20env%3Aproduction%20stage%3Aproduction%20*%3ALC41456F688&from_ts=1749135882851&to_ts=1749740682851&live=false
 _*Disclaimer:* These error logs have been located and analyzed by AI. Human review is advised for final confirmation._
